intro: Balanophora fasciculigera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ghost orchid, is a rare and unusual orchid species native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a holoparasitic plant, meaning it derives all its nutrients from its host plants without performing photosynthesis. The plant has a distinctive appearance with small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are specialized for attachment to host trees, and it lacks leaves, relying entirely on its host for sustenance. Due to its unique biology and habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited distribution.
